title: (x) "Kunst Kredit 1980/81" Wolfgang Weingart poster - Akzidenz-Grotesk {Chris L}
content:
Can anybody help me out with the font used for “KUNST 1980/81” on this poster????

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [P0051\_02.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119161033/http:/typophile.com/files/P0051_02.jpg) | 104.88 KB |

 [‹ High Roller Studio intricate script logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119161033/http:/typophile.com/node/47726 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) White on black credits - ITC Eras {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119161033/http:/typophile.com/node/47721 "Go to next forum topic")
author: whomadd

comments.content:
It looks like the Super weight.

Weingart once told me the story of finding Job Cases of Akzidenz in a dust print lab in Basel. In those days, Ruder was his teacher and used mostly Univers. The trasure trove of lead type in AG made Weingart jump for joy.

ChrisL

AG was his favorite face. He loves the bolder weights. The one he used was a lead font, however.

[http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=423428&gclid=CLKH7q\_zs5QCF...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119161033/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=423428&gclid=CLKH7q_zs5QCFQQbFQodZiwYUg "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=423428&gclid=CLKH7q\_zs5QCFQQbFQodZiwYUg")

ChrisL
the other type on this poster looks like AG but the part that I am confused by is the numbers the word “KUNST”. They have a much more rounded and bulbous shape than AG which is what i’m looking for.

Perhaps VAG Rounded, the Volkswagon face? The other thing is just distortion from blowing up type with the benday screen over it?

ChrisL
oh yea i think thats the one! awesome thanks so much i really appreciate it!

My one and only ever in history successful font ID and it never gets recognized, falling off the radar before ever noticed :-(

ChrisL
I reckon there are a couple of IDers who must be glad I’m back, ya bunch of gloryhunters. :^P

Yves, Sorry to covet your badge of glory so much. When you have been beat out a million times by those much better than me, and have had but one success, you at least want that one paltry victory to be noted by the Belgian Master :-)  
Glad you are home safe, dude!

ChrisL
I was never really away, but maintaining the Type ID Board became a bit too much of a handful. :^/
